description.text: As the animals prepare for a special party, Ant feels a little left out.

introduction_text.text: The journey into the Magical Pantry begins with a simple knock, knock, knock.

text.text: On the morning of Hare's surprise party, $hero-name and the whole forest got up very early. Giraffe had important jobs for them to do. “What about me?" asked Ant. “We only have big jobs Ant. No small ones."
“That’s not fair," said Ant. “The fair? No, it's Hare's party Ant!" Giraffe replied. Ant knew no one was listening to him anymore. “It’s no use," he said. “Did you say juice?" Giraffe asked.
“It’s not a big job but do you want to help me make Hare’s favorite for the party?" $hero-name said. Ant nodded a small nod.
Sheep was mowing the lawn. “Be right back," Ant said to $hero-name. “Need a hand?" he asked Sheep. “No thanks, I'm almost done."
Then Lion, Lucky and Bear appeared. “I’ll grab a side!" said Ant. “You’ll hurt yourself, Ant, we've got this." Bear said.
Owl and Giraffe had put up the last decorations. “Need anything?" Ant asked. “Kind of you Ant, but we're done," said Owl.

recipe_steps.cta_label: Ant went back to the recipe.

text.text: “What time is Hare coming?" Ant asked. “Why, she’ll come when the party starts of course!" said Giraffe. Then they froze.
“We forgot to invite H-H-Hare!" cried Badger. “I’ll get her!" said Ant. “It’s too far," said Owl. “Trust me." said Ant.
Ant crawled with ease through his tunnels all the way to Hare’s burrow. “What are you doing here?" she said sleepily.
Ant and Hare emerged and made their way to the party. The others waited anxiously as $hero-name calmly finished up.

“Surprise!" they all said as Ant and Hare arrived. “How wonderful!" said Hare, eyeing her favorite dish. The party was saved. “Three cheers for Ant!" said Sheep. No one ever thought Ant was too small again.

description.text: Bear isn't feeling quite himself, so his friends make a plan to help.

introduction_text.text: The animals are ready to welcome you in the Magical Pantry, just behind these doors.

text.text: Spring had sprung in the forest, and everyone was feeling happy. Except for Bear. He was having a bad day, that was lasting a week. Nothing felt right and he didn't know why. All he could do was sigh.
“What’s wrong with Bear?" Badger asked. “Maybe he got stung by a bee?" “Or fell out of bed?" “Was it a sad story?" “Or a chipped tooth!" They all guessed. “We need to help," $hero-name said.
“When I’m feeling sad, you know what cheers me up? Something delicious. Maybe that’ll help?" $hero-name said.
That gave them all an idea. “When I have a bad day, I like to garden. I’ll make Bear a veggie patch!" Hare suggested.
Badger said, “I can help Hare. On my b-bad days I dig holes." “That'll do!" said $hero-name, looking up from the recipe.

recipe_steps.cta_label: It was starting to smell delicious.

text.text: “I like to be all cozy. I’ll make him a sweater. The weather is iffy this time of year," said Sheep. “Great!" said $hero-name.
“Finding treasures on the forest floor always makes my day. We'll bring the shiniest thing we find. Let's go!" said Ant.
Bear walked sadly towards the clearing. But then, something caught his attention. “That smells good," he said, sheepishly.
Each of the animal friends was hard at work getting their bad-day remedies ready. “I'll keep a look out," Giraffe said.
The closer Bear got; he heard a hubbub. He was so intrigued he didn't even notice that he stubbed his toe on the fence.

Bear arrived to find his friends all around. While he loved his Ant-sized treasure, cozy sweater, veggie patch and most delicious dish, it was being with his friends that made him forget about feeling bad.

description.text: The arrival of a new animal sends the forest into an uproar.

introduction_text.text: Let's see what adventures are about to unfold in the Magical Pantry.

text.text: One day, when $hero-name visited the magical forest, a terrible sound made everything wobble. “Is that a volcano? An earthquake? A meteor?” $hero-name asked. Badger’s eyes grew wider and wider.
“A lion has just moved in. He’s very f-f-f-frightening." said Badger. $hero-name thought for a moment and said, “I know just how to make a scary lion friendly instead". “You do?" said Ant.
“We’ll make my super, amazing, lion-friendlying $recipe-name." $hero-name continued. “Lion f-f-friendlying sounds good," said Badger.
“But Lions have such big teeth!" said Bear. “You have big teeth too," $hero-name replied, “You aren't so scary."
“And such big claws at the end of such b-b-big p-paws," added Badger. With a smile, $hero-name replied, “Big claws aren't so bad."
“Are you really sure you can make super, amazing, lion-friendlying $recipe-name?" “With your help I can Ant", $hero-name said.
Another roar rippled through the trees. “Please hurry. I can’t t-t-take it anymore!" said Badger. “Almost there", $hero-name said.
As the smell wafted through the trees, animals popped by to sneak a peek. “How succulently scrumptious!" proclaimed Raccoon.
The delicious smell of the lion-friendlying feast had traveled all the way into the Lion's cave.
“What if it doesn’t work? We'll all have to move," Badger whispered. “It will," said Ant, “I can feel it."

When it was ready, they placed it in front of Lion's cave. He pounced out from the darkness. “You made my favorite!" As he rolled around like a big kitten they thought, “He's not so f-f-frightening after all."

description.text: Big changes come to the forest, and not everyone is too pleased.

introduction_text.text: Welcome to the Magical Pantry, where animal friends are waiting to meet you.

text.text: One day there was commotion in the forest. Everyone was helping find the perfect spot for the brand-new picnic table. “Isn’t it marvelous?" said Ant. Owl thought not. “What's all this?" Owl hooted.
“Let’s have a picnic-table warming," $hero-name said, “I know just what to make!" Owl hooted indignantly. He didn’t like new things. He liked it when things stayed the same. “Count me out!" he said.
“But why?" asked Sheep. “I could make you a new shirt for the occasion!" “I don’t need clothes, I have feathers," replied Owl.
A friendly face popped down from the trees, “May I inquire as to the menu, I’m most intrigued,” said Racoon. $hero-name nodded.
“Sounds sc-c-crumptious!” Badger chimed in, “I could find some juicy worms if you need?” With a smile, $hero-name replied
Owl remained in his tree, “I’ll be eating on this very branch. Like always." “We could send some up?" $hero-name offered.
“No thank-you!” Owl said, “I'll eat what I always eat. I like what I like. And that's that." Owl's branch creaked slighty.
Owl edged along his branch for a closer look, “But, out of interest, what are you making?" Suddenly, something snapped!
The huge crack resounded through the forest. “Is everyone alright?" called $hero-name, who was almost finished cooking.
“Oh no! My branch! What will I do!" cried Owl. The other animals didn’t know what to say to comfort him. $hero-name had an idea.
“We fixed your branch", Ant said, as they sat at the table to eat the delicious food. Owl perched next to them and said, “This really is much better." When nobody was looking, he even took a bite.
